description: Proximity is how CBC News builds trust and grows relationships with you, the people we serve, including those of you with whom we have weak or little connection. Here are the most recent additions to our team who will help bring us closer to you across the country.
title: Meet the new journalists bringing CBC News closer to you

description: Organizers of a Belgian classical music festival said they cancelled an orchestra's performance because they weren’t able to clarify conductor Lahav Shani’s “attitude to the genocidal regime in Tel Aviv” — a decision that’s being called antisemitic.
title: Music festival cancels performance led by Israeli conductor over war in Gaza

description: Wastewater and other disease indicators for COVID are beginning to increase in parts of Canada, infectious disease physicians say, as students and teachers return to school and people begin to congregate indoors.
title: COVID cases starting to climb across parts of Canada

description: Pierre Poilievre says he worries for his family as political violence concerns grow in the U.S. and Canada following the fatal shooting of an American right-wing activist. The Conservative leader believes all of Canada's top politicians should have protection.
title: Poilievre says he worries for his family as political violence concerns grow in Canada, U.S.

description: While there was plenty of protests outside, one could hear a pin drop inside Scotiabank Centre as Montreal's Gabriel Diallo opened the tie with a 6-1, 6-2 dismantling of Israel's Daniel Cukierman on Friday in Halifax.
title: Protests outside, silence inside as Canada goes up 1-0 on Israel at Davis Cup tie

description: People in Cambridge, Ont., were buzzing on Friday as social media posts started popping up of Justin and Hailey Bieber visiting various local businesses. One photo shared by the pop singer, who grew up in neighbouring Stratford, on his Instagram account showed him shooting pool.
title: Cambridge, Ont., buzzing after Justin and Hailey Bieber make stops in local businesses

description: Canadian construction and union leaders say they’re frustrated over the continued use of foreign workers for non-specialized tasks at the massive NextStar EV battery plant project in Windsor, Ont., that’s receiving billions in taxpayer support.
title: Concerns over reports foreign workers seen doing non-specialized tasks at Windsor, Ont., EV battery plant site

description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that he would send National Guard troops to Memphis, Tenn., to combat crime, following his administration's unprecedented police takeover in Washington, D.C., last month.
title: Memphis next target for National Guard deployment, Trump says

description: Ottawa is bringing back its program to help Canadians make retrofits to their homes — this time with a focus on those who can’t afford them, it says.
title: Federal greener homes program returns with focus on affordability

description: A monthly update of the Canadian Drought Monitor shows almost all of Prince Edward Island in the red, representing 'extreme drought,' with a small area around Wood Islands a little better off with only 'severe drought' conditions.
title: Much of Atlantic region is officially suffering 'extreme drought,' Agriculture Canada confirms

description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand said Russian Ambassador Oleg Stepanov was summoned Wednesday for an "official reprimand."
title: Canada reprimands Russian ambassador following incursion into Polish airspace

description: A Manitoba cabinet minister has offered a public apology after reposting an Instagram message filled with disparaging commentary about conservative activist Charlie Kirk on the day after he was shot and killed in the United States.
title: Manitoba minister apologizes for Instagram repost condemning Charlie Kirk a day after assassination

description: Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson says the federal government is in discussions with Alberta and oil companies about oilsands emissions, amid reports the federal emissions cap could be on the chopping block.
title: Feds in discussions with Alberta, oil companies about 'emissions intensity' of oilsands

description: Nwodim announced Friday on Instagram that she would not be returning to Saturday Night Live, thanking show creator Lorne Michaels for the opportunity, and her castmates, writers and crew "for their brilliance, support and friendship."
title: Ego Nwodim is leaving SNL cast after seven seasons

description: The union representing Canada's 55,000 postal workers says it wants Canada Post to return to the bargaining table and commit to a "fair, ratifiable" contract with its employees or it will "consider stronger actions" to move labour negotiations along.
title: Union demands Canada Post return to bargaining or it will 'consider stronger actions'

description: Nepal's former chief justice Sushila Karki has been chosen as the country's interim leader, said an official from Nepal president's office, after violent anti-corruption protests forced Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli to resign this week.
title: Nepal's president appoints interim premier after fiery protests collapse previous administration

description: A regulator has approved a world-first vaccine to protect koalas from chlamydia infections, which are causing infertility and death in the iconic native species that is listed as endangered in parts of Australia.
title: Australia approves vaccine to protect koalas from chlamydia

description: Streets, basements and businesses were flooded out after a torrential rainstorm hammered the southern Manitoba city of Steinbach on Thursday night.
title: Southern Manitoba city flooded after 103 mm of rain in 4 hours

description: A humpback whale known as Tutu was tangled up in more than 130 metres of fishing gear, before being freed.
title: Humpback whale tangled in fishing gear on B.C.'s coast freed after 3-day rescue

description: Poland rejected on Friday a suggestion by Donald Trump that Russian drone incursions into its airspace could have been a mistake, a rare contradiction of the U.S. president from one of Washington's closest European allies.
title: Polish officials insist Russian drones weren't in airspace by mistake, as suggested by Trump

description: Pregnant Albertans are eligible for a free COVID-19 vaccine this fall, but doctors say they are not aware of any clear messaging from the provincial government to either patients or health-care providers.
title: COVID-19 vaccine free for pregnant Albertans but many don't know that, doctors warn

description: A major report on modernizing the education system in Newfoundland and Labrador is peppered with fake sources some educators say were likely fabricated by generative artificial intelligence.
title: N.L.'s 10-year education action plan cites sources that don't exist

description: Patricia Ann Kucerovsky, a school teacher and mother of two, was poisoned with mercury for months leading up to her death in 2008, according to police.
title: Fredericton police reopen investigation into unsolved homicide by mercury poisoning

description: Two ministers are directing the public service to review all current and planned federal contracts in an effort to find cost savings.
title: Ministers directing review of government contracts to cut costs

description: Data about the recent waves of arrests and deportations by Immigration and Customs Enforcement do not support Donald Trump's claim that his administration is targeting "the worst of the worst," nor does is the agency on track to reach its stated goal of one million deportations per year.
title: How ICE enforcement tactics have changed under Trump

description: The Sceptres star defender is likely to lead the Canadian women's hockey team's blue line at the Milan-Cortina Olympics in February.
title: 'The best defender in the world': Inside the rise of women's hockey superstar Renata Fast

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney's government is expected to introduce legislation as early as Tuesday to crack down on people willfully intimidating and obstructing individuals entering places of worship, cultural community centres and schools, CBC News has learned.
title: Carney government introducing bill to protect people entering religious, cultural buildings

description: The Port of Montreal's expansion is among five high-priority infrastructure projects Prime Minister Mark Carney has targeted to fast-track via the newly created Major Projects Office (MPO).
title: Carney wants to fast-track the Port of Montreal expansion. Here's what's at stake

description: Canada's spy agency had “extensive” interest in the Gustafsen Lake standoff in B.C. in 1995, keeping tabs on developments in a previously secret investigation into “Native extremism,” newly declassified documents show. The papers are bringing new information, and questions, to light 30 years later.
title: CSIS investigated Gustafsen Lake standoff in 1995 'Native extremism' probe, records show

description: The University of Toronto’s Law school is launching an animal law program. The faculty says its the first program of its kind at a Canadian law school. It comes at a time when animal welfare and rights are top of mind.
title: First of its kind new animal law program at U of T 'a long time coming'

description: The handgun at the centre of an RCMP investigation on Prince Edward Island has been the subject of a flurry of lawsuits and counter-lawsuits involving its manufacturer — and was recently acquired in large numbers by the Canadian Armed Forces.
title: Handgun widely used by Canadian military at centre of RCMP misfiring investigation

description: Israel’s government claims capturing the territory’s largest population centre is essential to defeating the remnants of Hamas, where many of its remaining fighters are believed to be holding out. But Palestinians see leaving Gaza City as the end of any hope for the possibility of a future Palestinian state.
title: Israel's attack on Qatar was an escalation, but its invasion of Gaza City is even more consequential

description: An election to Norway’s Sámi Parliament this week returned major gains for a party opposed to land rights and other special privileges for the Indigenous group.
title: Party challenging Indigenous rights sees major gains in Norway's Sámi Parliament election

description: If you missed the Toronto International Film Festival — or simply struggled to get tickets to any of the 291 films on offer — here's a list of some of our favourite titles.
title: The 7 best, buzziest and most beautiful films at TIFF 2025
